events.name: webhookEvent
events.description: This method is called every time a Dropbox Business webhook event occurs
steps: Create an app or select your Dropbox Business app
To have successful URL verification when you create your dropbox webhook, you need to have your RapidAPI code snippet running already
Scroll down to the 'Webhooks' section and add the following URL: __WEBHOOK_URL__

blocks.name: getAccessToken
blocks.description: Generates user access token

args.name: redirectUri
args.info: Redirect uri set for your app

blocks.name: revokeAccessToken
blocks.description: Revokes user access tokens

blocks.name: getSingleMemberDevices
blocks.description: List all device sessions of a team's member.

args.name: includeWebSessions
args.info: Whether to list web sessions of the team's member The default for this field is True.

args.name: includeDesktopClients
args.info: Whether to list linked desktop devices of the team's member The default for this field is True.

args.name: includeMobileClients
args.info: Whether to list linked mobile devices of the team's member The default for this field is True.

blocks.name: getMembersDevices
blocks.description: List all device sessions of a team's member.

args.name: cursor
args.info: At the first call to the getMembersDevices the cursor shouldn't be passed. Then, if the result of the call includes a cursor, the following requests should include the received cursors in order to receive the next sub list of team devices

args.name: includeWebSessions
args.info: Whether to list web sessions of the team's member The default for this field is True.

args.name: includeDesktopClients
args.info: Whether to list linked desktop devices of the team's member The default for this field is True.

args.name: includeMobileClients
args.info: Whether to list linked mobile devices of the team's member The default for this field is True.

blocks.name: revokeSingleDeviceWebSession
blocks.description: Revoke a web session of a team's member

args.name: teamMemberId
args.info: The unique id of the member owning the device

blocks.name: revokeSingleDeviceMobileSession
blocks.description: Unlink a linked mobile device

args.name: teamMemberId
args.info: The unique id of the member owning the device

blocks.name: revokeSingleDeviceDesktopSession
blocks.description: Unlink a linked desktop device

args.name: teamMemberId
args.info: The unique id of the member owning the device

args.name: deleteOnUnlink
args.info: Whether to delete all files of the account (this is possible only if supported by the desktop client and will be made the next time the client access the account) The default for this field is False.

blocks.name: revokeDevicesSession
blocks.description: Unlink a linked desktop device

args.name: revokeDevices
args.info: List of devices. For example: {"web_session" : {"session_id": "123", "team_member_id" : "321"}, "mobile_client" : {"session_id": "123", "team_member_id" : "321"}, "desktop_client" : {"session_id": "123", "team_member_id" : "321", "delete_on_unlink" : true}}

blocks.name: getTeam
blocks.description: Retrieves information about a team.

blocks.name: createGroup
blocks.description: Creates a new, empty group, with a requested name.

args.name: groupExternalId
args.info: The creator of a team can associate an arbitrary external ID to the group.

args.name: groupManagementType
args.info: Whether the team can be managed by selected users, or only by team admins. Possible values: user_managed, company_managed, system_managed.

blocks.name: deleteGroup
blocks.description: Deletes a group. The group is deleted immediately. However the revoking of group-owned resources may take additional time.

blocks.name: getSingleGroup
blocks.description: Retrieves information about one group

blocks.name: getGroups
blocks.description: Retrieves information about several groups

blocks.name: getGroupJobStatus
blocks.description: Retrieves information about status of any of group job

args.name: groupJobId
args.info: Id of the asynchronous job. This is the value of a response returned from the method that launched the job

blocks.name: getTeamGroups
blocks.description: Lists groups on a team.

args.name: limit
args.info: Number of results to return per call. The default for this field is 1000.

blocks.name: paginateTeamGroups
blocks.description: Use this to paginate through all groups.

args.name: cursor
args.info: Indicates from what point to get the next set of groups.

blocks.name: addGroupMember
blocks.description: Adds member to a group.

args.name: memberIdType
args.info: Type of user id. Possible values: team_member_id, external_id, email.

args.name: accessType
args.info: Access type. Possible values: member, owner.

blocks.name: getGroupMembers
blocks.description: Lists members of a group.

args.name: limit
args.info: Number of results to return per call. The default for this field is 1000.

blocks.name: paginateGroupMembers
blocks.description: Use this to paginate through all members of the group.

args.name: cursor
args.info: Indicates from what point to get the next set of groups.

blocks.name: removeGroupMembers
blocks.description: Removes members from a group..

args.name: users
args.info: List of users to be removed from the group. Example [{".tag" : "email", "email" : "justin@emaple.com" }]

args.name: returnMembers
args.info: Whether to return the list of members in the group. Note that the default value will cause all the group members to be returned in the response. This may take a long time for large groups. The default for this field is True.

blocks.name: setGroupMemberAccessType
blocks.description: Sets a member's access type in a group.

args.name: memberIdType
args.info: Type of user id. Possible values: team_member_id, external_id, email.

args.name: accessType
args.info: Access type. Possible values: member, owner.

args.name: returnMembers
args.info: Whether to return the list of members in the group. Note that the default value will cause all the group members to be returned in the response. This may take a long time for large groups. The default for this field is True.

blocks.name: updateSingleGroup
blocks.description: Updates a group's name and/or external ID.

args.name: newGroupExternalId
args.info: New arbitrary external ID to the group.

args.name: newGroupManagementType
args.info: Whether the team can be managed by selected users, or only by team admins. Possible values: user_managed, company_managed, system_managed.

args.name: returnMembers
args.info: Whether to return the list of members in the group. Note that the default value will cause all the group members to be returned in the response. This may take a long time for large groups. The default for this field is True.

blocks.name: getSingleMemberLinkedApps
blocks.description: List all linked applications of the team member.

blocks.name: getMembersLinkedApps
blocks.description: List all applications linked to the team members' accounts.

args.name: cursors
args.info: If the result of the call includes a cursor, the following requests should include the received cursors in order to receive the next sub list of the team applications

blocks.name: revokeSingleLinkedApp
blocks.description: Revoke a linked application of the team member

args.name: keepAppFolder
args.info: Whether to keep the application dedicated folder (in case the application uses one) The default for this field is True.

blocks.name: revokeLinkedApps
blocks.description: Revoke linked applications of the team members

blocks.name: addTeamMember
blocks.description: Adds members to a team.

args.name: memberPersistentId
args.info: Persistent ID for member. This field is only available to teams using persistent ID SAML configuration.

args.name: sendWelcomeEmail
args.info: Whether to send a welcome email to the member. If send_welcome_email is false, no email invitation will be sent to the user. This may be useful for apps using single sign-on (SSO) flows for onboarding that want to handle announcements themselves. The default for this field is True.

args.name: memberRole
args.info: Describes which team-related admin permissions a user has. Possible values: member_only(default), support_admin, user_management_admin, team_admin

args.name: forceAsync
args.info: Whether to force the add to happen asynchronously. The default for this field is False.

blocks.name: checkAddTeamMemberStatus
blocks.description: Use this to poll the status of the asynchronous request of addTeamMember.

blocks.name: getTeamMembers
blocks.description: Lists members of a team.

args.name: limit
args.info: Number of results to return per call. The default for this field is 1000.

args.name: includeRemoved
args.info: Whether to return removed members. The default for this field is False.

blocks.name: getTeamMembersInfo
blocks.description: Returns information about multiple team members.

blocks.name: getSingleTeamMemberInfo
blocks.description: Returns information about single team member.

args.name: memberIdType
args.info: Argument for selecting a single user, either by team_member_id, external_id or email.

blocks.name: paginateTeamMembers
blocks.description: Use this to paginate through all team members.

args.name: cursor
args.info: Indicates from what point to get the next set of members.

blocks.name: recoverDeletedMember
blocks.description: Recover a deleted member.

args.name: memberIdType
args.info: Argument for selecting a single user, either by team_member_id, external_id or email.

blocks.name: removeTeamMember
blocks.description: Removes a member from a team.

args.name: memberIdType
args.info: Argument for selecting a single user, either by team_member_id, external_id or email.

args.name: destinationMemberIdType
args.info: Argument for selecting a single user, either by team_member_id, external_id or email.

args.name: destinationMemberId
args.info: If provided, files from the deleted member account will be transferred to this user.

args.name: adminMemberIdType
args.info: Argument for selecting a single user, either by team_member_id, external_id or email.

args.name: adminMemberId
args.info: If provided, errors during the transfer process will be sent via email to this user. If the destinationMemberId argument was provided, then this argument must be provided as well.

args.name: wipeData
args.info: If provided, controls if the user's data will be deleted on their linked devices. The default for this field is True.

args.name: keepAccount
args.info: Downgrade the member to a Basic account. The user will retain the email address associated with their Dropbox account and data in their account that is not restricted to team members. In order to keep the account the argument wipeData should be set to False. The default for this field is False.

blocks.name: checkRemoveTeamMemberStatus
blocks.description: Use this to poll the status of the asynchronous request.

blocks.name: sendWelcomeEmail
blocks.description: Sends welcome email to pending team member.

args.name: memberIdType
args.info: Argument for selecting a single user, either by team_member_id, external_id or email.

blocks.name: updateTeamMemberPermissions
blocks.description: Updates a team member's permissions.

args.name: memberIdType
args.info: Argument for selecting a single user, either by team_member_id, external_id or email.

args.name: newRole
args.info: Describes which team-related admin permissions a user has. Possible values: team_admin, user_management_admin, support_admin, member_only

blocks.name: updateTeamMemberProfile
blocks.description: Updates a team member's profile.

args.name: memberIdType
args.info: Argument for selecting a single user, either by team_member_id, external_id or email.

args.name: memberPersistentId
args.info: Persistent ID for member. This field is only available to teams using persistent ID SAML configuration.

blocks.name: suspendMemberFromTeam
blocks.description: Suspend a member from a team.

args.name: memberIdType
args.info: Argument for selecting a single user, either by team_member_id, external_id or email.

args.name: wipeData
args.info: If provided, controls if the user's data will be deleted on their linked devices. The default for this field is True.

blocks.name: unsuspendMemberFromTeam
blocks.description: Unsuspend a member from a team.

args.name: memberIdType
args.info: Argument for selecting a single user, either by team_member_id, external_id or email.

blocks.name: getTeamUsersActivityReport
blocks.description: Retrieves reporting data about a team's user activity.

blocks.name: getTeamLinkedDevicesReport
blocks.description: Retrieves reporting data about a team's linked devices.

blocks.name: getTeamMembershipReport
blocks.description: Retrieves reporting data about a team's membership.

blocks.name: getTeamStorageUsageReport
blocks.description: Retrieves reporting data about a team's storage usage.

blocks.name: setActiveArchivedFolder
blocks.description: Sets an archived team folder's status to active.

args.name: teamFolderId
args.info: The ID of the team folder.

blocks.name: archiveTeamFolder
blocks.description: Sets an active team folder's status to archived and removes all folder and file members.

args.name: teamFolderId
args.info: The ID of the team folder.

args.name: forceAsyncOff
args.info: Whether to force the archive to happen synchronously. The default for this field is False.

blocks.name: checkArchiveFolderStatus
blocks.description: Returns the status of an asynchronous job for archiving a team folder.

blocks.name: createTeamFolder
blocks.description: Creates a new, active, team folder.

blocks.name: getTeamFoldersMetadata
blocks.description: Retrieves metadata for team folders.

args.name: teamFolderIds
args.info: The list of team folder IDs.

blocks.name: getTeamFolders
blocks.description: Lists all team folders.

args.name: limit
args.info: The maximum number of results to return per request. The default for this field is 1000.

blocks.name: deleteArchivedFolder
blocks.description: Permanently deletes an archived team folder.

args.name: teamFolderId
args.info: The ID of the team folder.

blocks.name: renameTeamFolder
blocks.description: Changes an active team folder's name.

args.name: teamFolderId
args.info: The ID of the team folder.

args.name: teamFolderName
args.info: The new name of the team folder.

blocks.name: getAuthenticatedAdmin
blocks.description: Returns the member profile of the admin who generated the team access token used to make the call.

blocks.name: permanentlyDelete
blocks.description: Permanently delete the file or folder at a given path

args.name: path
args.info: Path in the user's Dropbox to delete.
